2022-06-19T20:03:21Z: And that's all from us! We'll see you in two weeks' time for the British Grand Prix at Silverstone. Thank you, as always, for joining us - and we hope you enjoy the rest of your evening. Goodnight!
2022-06-19T20:02:06Z: Got your breath back? Fancy revisiting the race in word form? We got you: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-canadian-gp-verstappen-holds-off-sainz-after-late-safety-car-hamilton-third/10325379/
2022-06-19T19:47:36Z: Alonso's weaving incident will now be investigated by the stewards.
2022-06-19T19:44:09Z: There's an incident noted involving Alonso for weaving on the straight.
2022-06-19T19:41:20Z: Ocon takes sixth, and Alonso indeed claims seventh ahead of Bottas. Zhou bags ninth place, with Stroll taking the final point at his home race.
2022-06-19T19:40:37Z: Lewis Hamilton is third, taking his first podium since the Bahrain opener, as Russell gets fourth.
2022-06-19T19:40:24Z: Alonso defends all the way to the finish line to keep hold of seventh from Bottas! That was close!
2022-06-19T19:39:55Z: Max Verstappen holds off Carlos Sainz to win the 2022 Canadian Grand Prix!
2022-06-19T19:39:25Z: Not this time, and Verstappen's just covered him off into the final lap. Game over, it seems.
2022-06-19T19:38:07Z: Lap 69, and Sainz is going to have one more go. He's gone quicker than Verstappen on the previous lap...can he do it?
2022-06-19T19:38:02Z: Gasly has run off track at the final chicane during his battle with Albon for 13th place. The AlphaTauri driver avoids any further drama and continues.
2022-06-19T19:34:08Z: Verstappen's crucially got the legs in the first couple of sectors - Sainz finds the time to match in the final sector, but he's just not close enough by the time they launch off the hairpin. Lap 66/70 now.
2022-06-19T19:32:27Z: Better news for Aston Martin comes from Stroll, who gets by Ricciardo for 10th with the aid of DRS on the back straight.
2022-06-19T19:32:12Z: A 1m15.749s for Sainz at the end of lap 63. Although catching is one thing, passing is quite another.
2022-06-19T19:31:24Z: The stewards have opted to review that Vettel incident behind the safety car after the race.
2022-06-19T19:30:57Z: Sainz is throwing punches at Verstappen, but he's too far off to make anything work at the moment. The Red Bull driver seems to be in control here.
2022-06-19T19:30:12Z: A safety car infringement incident involving Vettel has been noted by the race stewards.
2022-06-19T19:28:48Z: Leclerc gets by Ocon again, this time at the hairpin. P5 for the Ferrari driver, but has a 4s gap to Russell to bridge.
2022-06-19T19:28:47Z: Vettel is another struggling after the safety car period, as he swaps places with Stroll, on mediums, to allow his team-mate to go after Ricciardo and the points positions.
2022-06-19T19:27:27Z: Leclerc goes straight on at the chicane, and had passed Ocon but yields the position to have another go.
2022-06-19T19:27:09Z: Magnussen's pace has dropped like a stone as he's now in last place having been passed by Norris and Latifi.
2022-06-19T19:26:04Z: Sainz is keeping close to Verstappen, and we'll be watching like a hawk to see if the Spanish driver can make a pass. Meanwhile, Leclerc clears Alonso and will have Ocon next up.
2022-06-19T19:25:25Z: Leclerc is up to sixth, getting by Alonso up the inside going into the hairpin. Great move.
2022-06-19T19:24:37Z: It's been a bad couple of laps for Vettel, who loses the final points place to Ricciardo, while further back Magnussen has dropped behind Gasly to 15th.
2022-06-19T19:23:25Z: Sainz does a 1m16.287s to keep tabs on Verstappen, can he put pressure on the leader?
2022-06-19T19:23:16Z: Zhou gets by Vettel around the outside into Turn 1 to take ninth place. That's a smart move by the F1 rookie.
2022-06-19T19:22:33Z: Leclerc, on the medium tyres just like Alonso and Ocon ahead of him, can't find a way through yet but the DRS has now been enabled.
2022-06-19T19:22:11Z: Verstappen's kept afloat ahead of Sainz, as Hamilton's got a little bit of an advantage over Russell now. Leclerc's right on the back of the Alpines.
2022-06-19T19:21:02Z: All very well behaved by the midfield too at that restart, as they all follow in order.
2022-06-19T19:20:36Z: Verstappen gets us going again out of the chicane, with Sainz sticking with him. Hamilton, Russell, Ocon and Alonso are separated by little too.
2022-06-19T19:19:33Z: Verstappen eases off to try and get the jump off the restart...as is tradition.
2022-06-19T19:18:10Z: The safety car is coming in this lap.
2022-06-19T19:16:40Z: All lapped cars are also being allowed to unlap themselves: Magnussen, Stroll, Gasly, Albon, Norris and Latifi.
2022-06-19T19:15:50Z: Tsunoda's AlphaTauri has been recovered at Turn 2 so we'll be close to getting back underway now.
2022-06-19T19:12:08Z: Moments before Tsunoda's off, Norris was given a five-second penalty for speeding in the pitlane, meaning the McLaren driver's afternoon has gone from bad to worse.
2022-06-19T19:11:25Z: Ocon and Alonso both pit too, preserving their fifth and sixth places ahead of Leclerc - who moves up to seventh as Bottas pits.
2022-06-19T19:10:18Z: Sainz pits - Verstappen retakes the lead, but he'll be right under fire from Sainz when we get a restart.
2022-06-19T19:10:11Z: That was, er, not great by Tsunoda. Coming out of the pits on fresh hards, he locks up at pit exit and takes a one-way trip into the Montreal scenery.
2022-06-19T19:08:38Z: Tsunoda has crashed at Turn 2! Safety Car deployed!
2022-06-19T19:08:14Z: No need, as Stroll pits just as Leclerc pulls alongside him, so it releases the Ferrari driver into eighth place. Stroll comes out in 13th.
2022-06-19T19:07:11Z: Leclerc dives by Zhou at Turn 1 for ninth place, so he's now in first class in the Stroll DRS train. I hope Stroll checks his ticket.
2022-06-19T19:06:28Z: Hamilton now does a 1m16.769s, proving that the Mercedes isn't all that bad after all.
2022-06-19T19:04:46Z: It's a 1m16.959s for Verstappen, as Sainz plans to try and extend his stint. Russell, meanwhile, comes in for a stop.
2022-06-19T19:04:24Z: On lap 45, Leclerc is undoing Ferrari's poor pitstop work, as he now gets by Tsunoda on the back straight for 10th place. Next up is Zhou.
2022-06-19T19:02:14Z: Leclerc, shaking his head leaving the pits, is on fresh mediums and that's enough to get him ahead of Ricciardo to move up a carriage in the Stroll train.
2022-06-19T19:00:35Z: Leclerc finally makes a stop, giving Ocon free breathing room, and grabs the medium tyre. But it's a slow stop for Leclerc, which puts him right onto the back of the Lance Locomotive.
2022-06-19T18:58:57Z: This race has turned into a bit of stalemate with the various DRS trains and balance tyre degradation. It'll come alive again soon, we promise.
2022-06-19T18:58:43Z: Sainz has brought the lead down to 5.9s as of the start of lap 42, having taken a second out of Verstappen in the last two laps. Russell's within about 8s of Hamilton now.
2022-06-19T18:55:58Z: TV directors having the easiest job in the world - basically a binary choice between Ocon and Leclerc, or the Stroll train.
2022-06-19T18:55:09Z: Russell, meanwhile, is slowly catching Hamilton having got fresher boots on his Mercedes. Hamilton has, however, picked up the pace a little bit.
2022-06-19T18:53:49Z: Leclerc is a little miffed over the radio, unable to pass Ocon ahead of him. Alonso's wisely staying out of that fight, instead holding back to try to preserve some tyre life.
2022-06-19T18:53:38Z: Gasly pits for a second time in this race and comes out in 17th place.
2022-06-19T18:52:16Z: Due to the track characteristic of slow corners and long straights, overtaking is all about having early traction and top speed. Which is why some overtakes are a breeze, and others impossible. Zhou is facing the latter behind Stroll.
2022-06-19T18:47:42Z: Stroll, still yet to pit in ninth, now leads at DRS train of Zhou, Tsunoda and Ricciardo.
2022-06-19T18:46:36Z: Ocon is definitely able to dart out of the corners quicker than Leclerc, as the Ferrari driver runs out of straight to get alongside the Alpine.
2022-06-19T18:45:27Z: Sainz is chipping away at Verstappen's lead now, taking about 0.2s a lap out of the Red Bull. Hamilton remains third, a good 10s clear of Russell, with Ocon a further 15s back.
2022-06-19T18:43:01Z: Alonso finally calls it a day on his medium tyres and comes in to stop. He rejoins in P7, behind the Ocon/Leclerc scrap.
2022-06-19T18:41:49Z: Leclerc is another driver stuck behind a rival. The Ferrari can't get the zip with DRS against the slippery through the air Ocon in his Alpine. Leclerc's tyres must be losing traction as he's yet to stop.
2022-06-19T18:39:39Z: The gaps among the top six have strung out a bit - although Sainz is trying to do something about that and logs a 1m17.210s to close in to within 9s of Verstappen.
2022-06-19T18:38:30Z: Zhou, who also stopped earlier, can't match the top speed of the yet-to-stop Stroll which is frustrating the Alfa Romeo driver stuck in 10th place.
2022-06-19T18:37:08Z: After his very slow stop Norris has come out in 17th, only ahead of Latifi out of the runners left in this race.
2022-06-19T18:36:11Z: Hamilton's next to get past Alonso, who's yet to stop, moving past with DRS to grab third place.
2022-06-19T18:36:07Z: During that second Virtual Safety Car period McLaren had a nightmare at the pitstops. Ricciardo had a slow stop, which dropped him to 12th, and double-stacking Norris only compounded the delay as his tyres weren't ready.
2022-06-19T18:34:26Z: Sainz gets some temperature in his tyres and immediately gets after Alonso, getting a good run out of the hairpin and making a clearance with DRS into the chicane at the end of lap 22.
2022-06-19T18:33:44Z: Leclerc is still on the move! After a handful of drivers pitted ahead of him, he gets by Bottas at the final chicane and moves up to seventh place.
2022-06-19T18:32:47Z: And Sainz comes in, coming out behind Alonso as he caught the pit exit just as the VSC was ending. Hamilton's right behind the Ferrari, but Sainz is slowly edging away.
2022-06-19T18:32:10Z: Strange timing for Schumacher, as soon as Zhou pulled alongside, it appeared his Haas car let go and he had no choice but to stop in the Turn 8 run-off area.
2022-06-19T18:30:54Z: Russell immediately comes in, as does Ocon - nice and cheap pitstops for them.
2022-06-19T18:30:16Z: Schumacher has stopped at the same place as Perez! The Haas driver was fighting Zhou for position but then went off track and slowed. That's triggered another Virtual Safety Car!
2022-06-19T18:29:58Z: Sainz is told that wear is better than expected, and he's keeping a relatively decent advantage over Verstappen out front - still over 4s the gap.
2022-06-19T18:29:16Z: Next lap around Albon duly pits, trading his mediums for hards, and comes out in 17th place.
2022-06-19T18:27:55Z: On lap 18 Bottas get the move done around the outside on Albon before reaching the final chicane, and Albon's compromised line gives a freebie pass to Leclerc before they reach Turn 1.
2022-06-19T18:27:10Z: Sainz has picked up the pace again, but Verstappen's done a 1m17.356s - 0.35s quicker than the Ferrari. Gap between the two stands at five seconds.
2022-06-19T18:26:36Z: Albon hugs the inside line to force Bottas, with DRS, to try to go around the outside, but he hasn't got enough straight to get ahead of the Williams before the final chicane.
2022-06-19T18:25:03Z: And indeed, Verstappen grabs a tow off Alonso and clears the Alpine with DRS. Pretty simple pass there for the Dutchman.
2022-06-19T18:24:56Z: Albon is making his Williams as wide as possible to keep Bottas behind him in the fight for 10th, which in turn is holding up Leclerc.
2022-06-19T18:23:39Z: Sainz's pace has dropped a little bit, having been in Verstappen's ballpark in the 1m17s, but is in the 1m18.3s. The Red Bull is now on Alonso's tail.
2022-06-19T18:22:28Z: Leclerc gets ahead of Norris, using DRS to charge into the final chicane up the inside and into 12th place.
2022-06-19T18:21:37Z: Verstappen does a 1m17.370s, a tenth faster than Sainz on lap 13.
2022-06-19T18:20:11Z: Hamilton has a crack at Ocon for fifth, drawing alongside - but Ocon holds the inside for the chicane. No matter, Hamilton says, and draws alongside to get fifth into Turn 1.
2022-06-19T18:20:10Z: Leclerc watch: He's still 13th, tucked up behind Norris, but he didn't pit under the virtual safety car having started on the hards.
2022-06-19T18:18:51Z: Latifi and Tsunoda also pitted under the Virtual Safety Car, which was effectively a free stop for the Japanese driver as he comes back out in 15th ahead of Vettel, Gasly, Latifi and Magnussen.
2022-06-19T18:17:52Z: Sainz and Alonso hence assume the top two positions as Verstappen rejoined in third. Full racing pace resumes once more.
2022-06-19T18:16:22Z: Perez appears to lose drive instantly and that's his race run, as he stops at Turn 8. The marshals spring into action to push the stricken Red Bull behind the barriers.
2022-06-19T18:16:03Z: Verstappen immediately takes the opportunity to pit, as does Hamilton. Hard tyres for both drivers.
2022-06-19T18:14:10Z: Magnussen pits for a new front wing, and gets new medium tyres as well. That puts him to the back - a shame for the Dane.
2022-06-19T18:14:06Z: Leclerc has benefitted from those early pitters to climb to 14th place - make that 13th as Perez is crawling to a halt with an engine issue!
2022-06-19T18:12:58Z: After starting with a bit of graining, Sainz is closing Verstappen down a bit now and does a 1m17.974s. The Red Bull responds with a 1m17.828s, however.
2022-06-19T18:12:47Z: Bottas has been shown the black and white flag for that first lap Turn 14 discretion.
2022-06-19T18:12:01Z: Zhou dives ahead of Ricciardo at the hairpin to take ninth place to cement his strong start to the race.
2022-06-19T18:11:58Z: It's a black and orange flag for Magnussen, which will be a big hit as Haas will have to change that.
2022-06-19T18:11:04Z: Both Gasly and Vettel pit at the end of lap five, which is extremely early without a time-saving safety car.
2022-06-19T18:10:50Z: Sainz has now stabilised the gap to Verstappen which had opened out to more than three seconds, as Russell now clears Magnussen to get fifth.
2022-06-19T18:09:07Z: Gasly is struggling with a car issue and has dropped down to 18th place behind Leclerc.
2022-06-19T18:08:27Z: Bottas has bonked the bollard at Turn 14 which could get him in trouble with the race stewards. The debris is picked up by the marshals so no immediate trouble.
2022-06-19T18:06:57Z: Bottas has an off-track moment at the final corner and drops behind Perez and Albon and into 13th place as a result.
2022-06-19T18:06:46Z: Hopes of Alonso nicking the lead from Verstappen have evaporated pretty quickly, as the Alpine driver has a mirror full of Sainz.
2022-06-19T18:06:16Z: Russell makes a smart move up the inside of Schumacher at the hairpin on the opening lap to take seventh place off the Haas driver.
2022-06-19T18:05:35Z: At the back Leclerc has made up a spot on Latifi, as has Tsunoda, which puts the Canadian to the back of the pack.
2022-06-19T18:04:48Z: Verstappen holds off from Alonso off the start, as Sainz goes with them. Hamilton and Magnussen having a lovely little battle into Turn 3, as Schumacher drops a spot to Ocon.
2022-06-19T18:04:07Z: And the 2022 Canadian Grand Prix is go!
2022-06-19T18:00:55Z: The formation lap gets under way! Let the anticipation build...
2022-06-19T17:59:13Z: Tyre news: everyone on mediums EXCEPT Bottas, Perez, Norris, Stroll and Leclerc.
2022-06-19T17:52:19Z: We've got the cringe out of the way, let's focus up on what could be a fascinating race. Risk of rain stands at 0%, and it's a temperate 20 degrees C out there.
2022-06-19T17:49:49Z: 10 minutes to go, so it's not long until the Canadian Grand Prix is aboot to get going eh.
2022-06-19T17:47:11Z: Will Alonso have a go, or will Verstappen see him off? Will Sainz factor in the battle? Will Stevens won the LMP2 category at Le Mans. How many times have I done this joke over the years?
2022-06-19T17:45:28Z: So, a tantalising prospect for a front row - Verstappen vs Alonso. In 2001, this was a back-of-the-grid battle; in 2022, it's something very different. And surprising.
2022-06-19T17:30:32Z: That's basically qualifying in a nutshell - but with dry conditions, the order could be mixed up once more.
2022-06-19T17:29:53Z: Gasly was one of Q1's big scalps, as neither Vettel or Stroll could progress past the first session despite Aston Martin looking good in practice.
2022-06-19T17:29:16Z: Bottas and Albon were knocked out in Q2, with Perez, Norris (who struggled with a PU issue) and Leclerc dispatched too. Leclerc starts 19th, ahead of Tsunoda on the back row.
2022-06-19T17:28:22Z: Hamilton starts fourth, and it's an all-Haas third row as the American team made the most of the opportunity. Ocon, Russell - after a slick gamble failed at the end of Q3 - Ricciardo and Zhou complete the top 10.
2022-06-19T17:27:31Z: Sainz had a bit of a slide on the final corner of his last lap, which means he starts third - but helpfully, his opposite number Perez hit the wall in Q2 and thus starts P13.
2022-06-19T17:26:30Z: Let's have a quick recap of qualifying: Verstappen took pole having largely looked a cut above the rest across all three of yesterday's sessions, as Alonso had great pace in the wet to grab his first front row start since 2012.
2022-06-19T17:16:16Z: Now into his third year of F1, Nicholas Latifi will now experience his first home race. To celebrate this event, he will take place next to the large vat of butterscotch pudding - as is indeed tradition.
2022-06-19T17:12:37Z: It was a wet old day at the Circuit Gilles Villeneuve, but it's shaping up to be a dry one today. For Charles Leclerc, who starts on the back row, it's going to be a tough ask to get a podium today - but there's a chance.
2022-06-19T17:10:08Z:

2022-06-19T17:04:30Z: Hello everyone, and welcome to our Autosport Live coverage for the Canadian Grand Prix! There's just under an hour to go until things get rolling in Montreal, and we're buckled up and ready for the late shift.
